summary: On the road to the final season I’m re-watching season 2. This is one of my favorite Sansa moment, on of my favorite Sansa...
body:
On the road to the final season I’m re-watching season 2. This is one of my favorite Sansa moment, on of my favorite Sansa smile. She is so pure here, so perfectly happy. She thinks she is now safe from the monster’s hands of Joffrey and, after months of frightening violence, she can be free again. One blissful moment to be remembered, before that monster 2.0 of Littlefinger lays his filthy hands on her. My poor Sansa 😭

Gif courtesy by @alaynesstone

tags: quite claiming that sansa is copying Dany's hair
anyone with eyes can see that
summary: “Sansa’s definitely come into her own, so she’s not emulating other people’s hairstyles anymore,” says Turner, about her...
text: Sansa’s definitely come into her own, so she’s not emulating other people’s hairstyles anymore,” says Turner, about her character’s evolution in the much-anticipated final season of the “Game of Thrones.” “She’s very much brought in her own thing — and made that her signature — and nobody else’s — and same with style. She’s found her own style. She’s not wearing those big poufy dresses that Cersei used to wear or she’s not wearing like her black, Little Finger-style dress. She’s got her own thing going on right now, which is really exciting.
source:
Sophie Turner

Once again, Sophie Turner has to put BraidGate to rest. “…SHE’S NOT EMULATING OTHER PEOPLE’S HAIRSTYLES ANYMORE”!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Sophie Turner

summary:
So rewatching game of thrones and the way ramsey treats sansa is so bizarre and actually makes no sense 
I know he’s a sadist...
body:
So rewatching game of thrones and the way ramsey treats sansa is so bizarre and actually makes no sense

I know he’s a sadist and enjoys hurting people but hes also not an idiot. He knows how important sansa is to his future and holding the north.

It makes no sense for him to torture and torment her. Getting her pregnant and having a child with her should be his mani priority. Especially given how desperately he wants to gain his fathers approval


Also while im at it. Why is roose allowing ramsey to treat sansa so badly? Even if ramsey doesn’t grasp how vital sansa is to their future roose knows. He’s there and has to know what ramsey is doing to sansa. His leaving ramsey torture her makes no sense

blog.name: cleverjonquil
blog.title: As strong as my lady mother
blog.description: Side blog for all my Sansa/Catelyn/Elia love. Critical of show!Dany but still like book!Dany. Tully Loyalist. Pro Northern Independence. Book Jon >>> Show Jon. I track #courtesyismyarmor and #daughterofrivers

tags: sansa knows women aren't the enemy
and having boys approve of you isn't the best compliment a woman can have
not like other girls is my least favorite trope ever
body:
Sansa Stark Appreciation Post #1

Sansa is a girl’s girl. She loves other women. She genuinely enjoys their company. Her role models tend to be women more often than men (Catelyn, Mordane, Naerys, Jonquil, and for a time, Margaery and Cersei). She doesn’t trash them or act better than them.

It’s rare in the fantasy genre (or… anywhere in fiction, honestly) to have a female character who prefers female friends. Usually you get a tomboy who is a daddy’s girl, and there’s nothing wrong with that; it’s just generally ingrained in our culture to value men’s company and ideas over women’s. It’s usually seen as a good thing to prefer your dad to your mom and like men over women.

Sansa respects men and women equally, though. You’ll never see her mentally berating other women for liking girly stuff, or bragging constantly that she has more male friends than female and is practically a guy herself, as YA heroines are famous for doing.

I grew up very similarly, with people sometimes acting like I’m a weird for not having close male friends, and I love the representation.

summary:
My mom walked in on me watching the Jon and Sansa reunion scene and asked oh are they lovers?
Quickly I explained their dynamic...
body:
My mom walked in on me watching the Jon and Sansa reunion scene and asked oh are they lovers?

Quickly I explained their dynamic of being raised as siblings but are cousins, etc

To which she said

Well why would they film it like a lovers reunion scene?!???

And then proceeded to sit down enthralled…..

summary: Sansa was inquisitive and instantly excepting of the following:
body:
Sansa was inquisitive and instantly excepting of the following:

JON-was murdered. And was magicly resurected.

BRAN-is now a psychic. Who can magicly see everything that is or ever was.

ARYA-can magicly remove her face. And literally become other people.

Please tell me how one of the strongest players in the game. Who is the ONLY person in the world that is currently aware of team Stark’s magic powers. Isn’t important? Or will turn on her family? Or won’t make it to the end?

title: Sansa Stark, the she-wolf
body:
Sansa’s glance toward Da&nerys is EVERYTHING, (if she had rifles Da&nerys will be dead ! really DEAD)

She’s half hidden in Jon’s fur (I can’t, cause I’m too emotional for this) she’s like the mother of the Wolves Pack, semi hidden but ready to jump to Da&nerys throat if something goes wrong.

Her eyes are icy, her skin is so white, watching out for her prey, she feels no fear but only quiet and patience.

She is THE SHE-WOLF

And she’s obviously NOT HAPPY but she’s already know as to manage Da&nerys

Jonsa fight is coming for the best

summary:
porcelain/ivory/steel
a sansa stark fanmix 
bones - ms mr/these are hard times for dreamers/blinding - florence + the machine/no...
body:
porcelain/ivory/steel

a sansa stark fanmix

bones - ms mr/these are hard times for dreamers/blinding - florence + the machine/no more calling like a crow for a boy/yellow flicker beat - lorde/i’m a princess cut from marble/gone and found - mø/what was i to do but flee when all my thoughts lay far beyond the sea?/lady - regina spektor/lady sings the blues so well/bravado - lorde/it’s a switch flipped, it’s a pill tipped back, it’s a moon eclipse/laura palmer - bastille/what terrifying final sights/youth - daughter/well i’ve lost it all, i’m just a silhouette/rootless - marina and the diamonds/building castles out of snow/elastic heart - sia/and let’s be clear i trust no one

I won’t lie, the more the actors say that people will not be satisfied or not like the ending, the more positive I feel that the ending will be just fine for me!
